ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I do things that are meaningful to me
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I am able to take care of my needs
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I am able to handle things when they go wrong
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I am able to do things that I want to do
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: My symptoms bother me
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I can be useful and productive
Notes: 1 = Not at all;2 = A little bit;3 = Somewhat;4 = Quite a bit;5 = Very Much

ElementDescription: I feel accepted as who I am
Notes: 1 = Not at all;2 = A little bit;3 = Somewhat;4 = Quite a bit;5 = Very Much

ElementDescription: I am optimistic that I can solve problems that I will face in the future
Notes: 1 = Not at all;2 = A little bit;3 = Somewhat;4 = Quite a bit;5 = Very Much

ElementDescription: MHSIP-Recovery and Stigma
Notes: meanRC1=6-((RC1A+RC1B+RC1C+RC1D+RC1E)/5)

ElementDescription: MARS-Recovery and Stigma
Notes: meanRC2=(RC2A+RC2B+RC2C)/3

ElementDescription: Combined-Recovery and Stigma
Notes: meanRC=(meanRC2+meanRC1)/2

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: Days since baseline
As a direct result of services I received, I deal more effectively with daily problems
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, I am better able to control my life
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, I am better able to deal with crisis
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, I am getting along better with my family
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, I do better in social situations
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, I do better in school and/or work
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, my housing situation has improved
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: As a direct result of services I received, my symptoms are not bothering me as much
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree;2 = Agree;3 = Neutral;4 = Disagree;5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Mean of Service Related Recovery (SRR)
Notes: mean (srr1-srr8)
